intro: Lastrea rimbachii, commonly known as the Rimbach's lastrea, is a unique member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and vibrant green coloration. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and display a striking combination of purple and white hues. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
